item.description: Pasini’s lab, Istituto Europeo di Oncologia July 2019 - Present Bioinformatician and PhD student Insert research here With the goal of completing a PhD thesis, I have been involved in the analysis of transcriptomics and epigenomics data to study the effects of mutations on the Wnt pathway that stabilize βcatenin, constitutively overactivate the pathway and cause mouse organoids and stem cells from small intestine acquire adenoma-like phenotype and characteristics.

item.title: Instituto de Biomedicina de Sevilla
item.description: Gene expression lab, Instituto de Biomedicina de Sevilla September 2017 - October 2018 Master’s thesis student and research assistant In the context of the master’s thesis (Universidad de Sevilla), under the supervision of Dr. Sebastián Chávez de Diego and Dr. Gabriel Gutierrez Pozo and within Dr. Victoria Begley’s PhD project, I started studying Xrn1, a protein involved in the degradation of mRNA, and it’s role in the nucleosome localization and transcription in Saccharomyces cerevisiae.

item.title: Microbial. Sistemes i aplicacions analítiques, S.L.
item.description: Intestinal microbial ecology, Microbial, S.L. September 2016 - June 2017 Internship and Bachelor’s thesis student In the context of the bachelor’s thesis (Universitat de Girona) and under the supervision of Prof. Jesús García-Gil, I studied the diversity of the ileal mucosa-related microbiota of colorectal cancer patients submitted to an ileostomy and its changes after a butyrate treatment. Using DNA extracted from human biopsies of ileal mucosa, we performed qPCR and high-throughput sequencing followed by a SPSS-based statistical analysis of to test the differences between the butyrate-treated, placebo-treated and untreated groups, and we found that some healthy-related butyrate-producing bacteria increased in proportion after the butyrate-treated, but not in the other groups.
